info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 8:48PM EDT until July 14 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Guilford.
* WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, High Point, McLeansville, Pleasant Garden, Jamestown, Lake Jeanette Marina, Lake Brandt, Lake Townsend, Lake Townsend Marina, Forest Oaks and Monticello. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT
